intro: Mikania orleansensis, commonly known as Orleans morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rapid growth and climbing habit. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue to purple in color. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and twining. Mikania orleansensis is often found in disturbed areas, such as roadsides and open woods, where it can thrive in partial shade to full sun.
